boardgame.name: Promesa
boardgame.description: Promesa is a first-person experience in which the viewer moves through memories, dreams and fantasies, exploring the narrative created by the images that emerge when you listen to someone else. It’s an audiovisual narrative where the focus is the individual relationship with space and in which movement is the only interaction. Promesa is composed by a series of 3D scenes and short texts that have always a different order.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 A MAZE. Awards Best Digital Moment Winner
2020 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Song of Bloom
boardgame.description: It's not a story, told behind a screen, it rather IS the story. It plays with the expectations of the player, and animates them to playfully explore the scenes. The game makes use of the whole device: It begins as a game, mainly controlled with known touch gestures, developing into something that is controlled through the whole device – gyroscope, volume buttons, charging cable.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2020 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2020 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2021 D.I.C.E. Best Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Roma & Alea: Charakter Erweiterung
Rome & Roll: Characters Expansion
Rome & Roll: Expansión de Personajes
boardgame.description:
3 extra characters (Pontifex, Nobilis and Artifitrix) that were created during the Kickstarter-campaign and are sold seperately afterwards.

The difference between each character is their starting advantage and the set of 3 advisors every character has,

listing.notes:
Never played, in perfect condition. Also available separately the main game (buying both has a discount of 5€).
Payment: Paypal friends or standard (+4%) - bank transfer - Revolut - Crypto
Ask for shipping rates.
Title: Rome & Roll: Character Expansion Publisher: PSC Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The Lockdown
boardgame.description:
A life-threatening virus breaks out, spreads at lightning speed and reaches Europe in no time. What was first described as a harmless flu turns out to quickly escalate into a pandemic in which affects millions of people.
Nobody was prepared for the arrival of the virus and a lockdown can no longer be prevented.

It is up to you, the experts, to get the crisis in your affected countries under control as quickly as possible. Assemble a team of specialists who can tackle this crisis as quickly and efficiently as possible. But beware of the virus, because it spreads very quickly. The medical sector is crying out for help and the economy is at point of collapsing. In addition, protective equipment is scarce, so be careful with face masks, protect the right team members and find the right balance between care and economy to save the country. Time is running out, because we cannot keep the countries in lockdown for longer than 10 weeks ....

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Booth: A Dystopian Adventure
boardgame.description:
The year is 2036. In this famine-riddled world, food-centric sovereignty has been established. Living alone inside a food-inspection booth, you are striving to find truth and peace beyond the borderline.

Source: The Developer Website.


User summary
The game is developed and published by Guanpeng Chen.

boardgame.description:
User Summary

boardgame.name: Encounter 2 - Adventure Pack
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Encounter 2 - Adventure Pack is part of Hellscape.

Encounter 2 - Adventure Pack is also considered part of the Infernal Flair subset that contains terrain pieces that are used in multiple encounter areas.

Encounter 2 - Adventure Pack is made of "Dwarvenite", metal pins, plastic translucent film, and LEDs to illuminate selected lava pieces. This item was initially available as part of a pledge level and as an add-on during the Hellscape Kickstarter. The item is available in painted or unpainted versions.

Encounter 2 - Adventure Pack comes with 13 pieces:
(1) Howling Devil Statue (LT-W09)
(2) Rupture Talon (LT-W08)
(1) Lemure Pool (LT-W12)
(1) Wall of Fire (LT-W17)
(3) 8x8 Straight Magma Flow Phantasmal Filters (GO-655)
(3) 8x8 River Styx Phantasmal Filters (GO-654)
(2) Magma Jumpy Stone (LR-W08)

boardgame.name: Asator
boardgame.description:
Asator is a 2 player or 2 team direct conflict, miniature based Viking themed dice chucker game. The goal of the game is to defeat the opposing army using a combination of strategy, magic, and skill. To win the battle, you must defeat the 3 leaders of the opposing army- the Master, the Chieftain, and the Wizard.
Each player gets an army of 30 soldiers.: The Master, The Wizard, The Chieftain, The Dragon, 8 Cavalry Units, 8 Archer units, and 10 Infantry Units. Each soldier’s Health Points, Weapons, and Movement Capabilities are tracked on their battle sheets. Changes to each of these along with magical effects are tracked on the battle sheets by the player throughout the game.
Asator is played on an approximate 26"x26" game mat with an approximate 1" hexagon grid allowing for maximum freedom of movement of the units.

—description from the designer

매시브 다크니스 2: 천상의 몰락

boardgame.name: Empedocle
boardgame.description:
Get rid of your Hatred and break the Empedocles cycle which opposes Love and Hatred inside the Terrestrial World, composed of four elements Air, Fire, Earth and Water.

Turn are played in 3 phases.

Players will choose their dice side and should have chosen a different side from other players to be able to take the chosen element. Otherwise they are eliminated from the turn.
They can modify their dice if they roll it with the risk of being eliminated. If they target alone an element, they can take it.
Each time they unify Air, Fire, Earth and Water elements, they are able to get rid of one Hatred fragment.


They win the game when they don't have any more Hatred fragment.

boardgame.name: Plinko
boardgame.description:
Plinko debuted as a reward for contestants who earned their chance to be on stage during the January 3, 1983 broadcast of the American version of “The Price is Right.” It has been adapted into a board game.

Players take turns quizzing each other about the prices of merchandise based on the various quizzes from the television series. Every correct answer earns the player one chip. At the end of the quiz, each player gets to drop their chips into the Plinko board where they may be worth $10,000 apiece!

The unit uses 3 “AA” batteries which activate lights, music, and sound effects but are not necessary for game play.

boardgame.name: The Lost Words
Die verlorenen Wörter
boardgame.description:
The Lost Words is a card game based on the stunning book by best-selling author Robert Macfarlane and acclaimed illustrator of over forty beloved classics, Jackie Morris.

The Lost Words is a simple draw/event/discard game with a take-that element via the action cards. The game is won by placing your spell (poem) cards over beautifully illustrated nature cards before your opponents. The players' quests will be blocked — or aided — by special action cards that create a most exciting dynamic throughout the game. The first player to match their four nature cards with the correct spell cards wins.

--description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 1942: Battle for the Mediterranean
boardgame.description:
"1942: Battle for the Mediterranean" is a two-player wargame simulation of the naval operations in the Mediterranean in January-October 1942. The objective in the game is to sink the largest possible number of enemy warships and enemy shipping, and to keep supplied their respective ground forces and bases in North Africa (for the Axis) and Malta (for the Allies).

Combat units represent individual capital ships (battleships, battlecruisers, heavy cruisers, light cruisers, fleet carriers, light carriers), destroyer or smaller escort divisions of 2-3 ships, individual submarines, groups of merchant ships and escorts vessels, and aircraft squadrons of 20-25 planes.

Each game turn represents 1 month of naval operations. The campaign game covers 10 game turns, from January to October 1942. There are also shorter 1-turn scenarios simulating the major convoy battles of the 1942 campaign: Second Sirte, Harpoon/Vigorous (Battaglia di Mezzo Giugno), or Pedestal (Battaglia di Mezzo Agosto).

boardgame.name: Forests of Pangaia
boardgame.description:
You are a young spirit of the forest, sent out by Gaia to bring the first life to the world. While you are growing your trees across the vast and barren lands of Pangaia, you must complete a series of rituals to honor Mother Nature. Those rituals unleash Gaia's energy of life and are the beginning of the endless cycle of growth and decay.

In Forests of Pangaia, you grow your own forest and contend with other players for territory. Strategic choices are crucial along the way. Will you keep your forest calm and isolated or mingle with others to reap the benefits gained from diversity?

boardgame.name: Choke On These Notes
boardgame.description:
Choke on these Notes is the Ultimate Party Game for Music Lovers! Test your music knowledge... without the music. There are over 230 of the most iconic songs from the past 6 decades. Each player takes a turn to guess the song of a card pulled by another player. The only clues are pieces of lyrics. You get 3 clues per card. Each clue ads on to the previous clue. If they guess it, they get scored off the last clue they used. If they Choke after hearing all clues, they get 0 points and their turn is over. Keep playing until you reach 30 points. It's more fun with teams. Test your knowledge of lyrics. It's harder than you think.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bye Bye Bad Guy
boardgame.description:
A quick playing, easy to learn party game, Bye Bye Bad Guy has the players taking the roll of an 80's or 90's action film star, in the last 10 minutes of the movie, right as they are about to defeat the villain. Players compete to come up with the best one liner to quip, right before killing the villain, right after the director sets the scene using the cards provided! Hilarious and quickly paced, this game is a must have fans of action films and quick-thinking quips!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Recruit Edition
boardgame.description:
Designed to be perfect for new players who've never tried Warhammer 40,000, the Recruit Edition is the ideal way to dip your toes into the thrilling world of battles in the 41st Millennium.

Whether you want to try Warhammer 40,000, are looking for the perfect gift for a curious friend, child or relative or just fancy reinforcing your Space Marines and Necrons armies, this set is for you!

Collect your set, build your models and discover how to play in a series of starter missions that make learning the game fun. When you're done, expanding your set with the Elite or Command Edition is simple!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: B-Movie Beatdown
boardgame.description:
A quick playing card game, where players use three separate decks to create bad movies, the like of which you'd watch at a Bad Movie Night. Amazingly quick to learn, and scalable to play at almost any length of time desired, B-Movie Beatdown is a sure hit at any party where lovers of trash cinema are at!

By using the decks of "Characters", "why the movies bad", and "Why the movies watchable", players combine a card from each deck, and then pitch their movie, to the person playing as the directory that turn. The director then decides on the best movie, passes the decks, and play continues until one player has won the number of hands decided upon as the amount necessary at the start of play, meaning the game can be as short or as long as the players like.

boardgame.name: Curse of Hearts
boardgame.description:

A house full of gay vampires

Help lost boys and daddy vampires find love and sustenance in this 5e adventure for characters no lower than level 3 or higher than 10

And all sorts of monsters. Get all queer up in here. Be a matchmaker. Quietly weep as you slay some of them? No. Why would you do that. Chateau Gayvenloft is a place of feels they may eat you, but in the name of love.

Content Warning - this product is not suitable for minors, baby vampires or those who don't like seeing scantily clad queer horrors

boardgame.name: Solar Flare
boardgame.description:
Solar Flare is a card game where you race against your friends to build the largest spaceship before the sun goes BOOM!

This is an all-ages game (5+) that is fun, fast (10-30 min/session), easy-to-learn, and have a ton of strategic depth.

Each deck allows for game sessions with 2-4 players and you can combine two decks to allow up to 8 players. The game is extremely portable (camping, lunch breaks, etc...) and there are lots of rule variations to adjust difficulty and length-of-play.

Card Types: There are 3 types of cards. Ship Segments (used to build), Action Cards (used to create change), and Solar Flares (used to end the game).

Set-up: Determine who goes first and set the number of Solar Flares that will end the game - recommendation would be to match the number of players (3 players = 3 Solar Flares). Take the 54 cards and spread-out/mix-up face down to create your junkyard. Each player selects three ship segments from the junkyard - if you draw a Solar Flare or Action then simply reshuffle until you have three segments.

Play: On your turn you grab one card from the junkyard and play it. If it is a Ship Segment, connect to your ship-build or leave off to the side (all cards are played face-up). If it is an Action Card, read out loud, execute the action, and return to the junkyard. If it is a Solar Flare then set to the side face-up.

Building: Building a ship is easy. At the bottom of every ship segment is a color and shape. Simply match the shape ("star" shapes are wild) to connect two pieces. You can sequence and reposition your ship at any time in the game.
Note that color matches are a scoring bonus.

Endgame: Once the last Solar Flare is drawn, the game stops. Everyone can organize their ship one last time before scoring. Scoring is simple; front/back/cross-connector segments are worth 10 points, all other ship segments are worth 5 points. If a connection matches in color, you get a bonus 5 points. Highest score wins!

Variation: If you are playing with young kids, simply make building a ship based on color-match and all segments are worth 10 points. To extend or shorten game length you can adjust the count of Solar Flare's needed. You can also play extended sessions by stacking multiple games, until someone hits a predetermined score (first to 500 points wins).

—description from the publisher

Kulkmann's G@mebox

boardgame.name: Twin Paradises of Bytopia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the hardest-working plane in the multiverse, the Twin Paradises of Bytopia!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Twin Paradises of Bytopia, where the residents work near constantly to build and repair objects because the plane constantly breaks things down!

boardgame.name: Nine Hells of Baator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the lowest pits of evil and torture in all the multiverse, the Nine Hells of Baator!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Nine Hells of Baator, where horrible varieties of evil and danger lurk across all nine layers, each ruled by an archdevil of supreme power commanding legions of devils in far-reaching plots!

boardgame.name: Heroic Domains of Ysgard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the epic wilderness found in the Heroic Domains of Ysgard!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Heroic Domains of Ysgard, where everything seems to take on an epic and heroic proportion! Big heroes, big adventures, big foes, big celestial giants, and more await the brave (or foolhardy), from the earthbergs to flaming landscapes to wildly shifting underground realms.

boardgame.name: Blessed Fields of Elysium
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the pastoral realm of peace and rest, the Blessed Fields of Elysium!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Blessed Fields of Elysium, a plane dedicated to the ideals of common good for all. Home to the guardinal celestials and other good creatures, Elysium offers the weary planewalker a chance for reste - but there are still plenty of secrets to uncover across its four layers, including within the mighty River Oceanus!

boardgame.name: Bleak Eternity of Gehenna
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the volcanic plane of cruel intentions, the Bleak Eternity of Gehenna!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Bleak Eternity of Gehenna, also known as the Fourfold Furnaces, where cruelty, selfishness, and greed walk together on volcanic slopes! Home to the yugoloths and a great number of other nasty creatures, Gehenna holds secrets aplenty above, on, and below the cliffs and mountainsides that encompass each dangerous layer.

boardgame.name: Gray Waste of Hades
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the endless realm of despair and suffering, the Gray Waste of Hades!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Gray Waste of Hades, the birthplace of the yugoloths and eternal battlefield in the never-ending Blood War between demons and devils. Learn about its powerful denizens and deal with the gods of death the rule over massive regions while staving off despair, hopelessness, and a horrendous wasting disease.

boardgame.name: Clockwork Nirvana of Mechanus
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the constantly moving, always synchronizing Clockwork Nirvana of Mechanus!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Clockwork Nirvana of Mechanus, the most ordered and rigid plane in the multiverse. It's the home of the modrons and inevitables, two similar species of constructs with vastly diffferent capabilities and outlooks, along with a host of mechanical creatures, powers, and organizations. It all runs like clockwork ... most of the time!

boardgame.name: Seven Heavens of Mount Celestia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the wondrous and breathtaking landscape contained within the rugged slopes of the Seven Heavens of Mount Celestia!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Seven Heavens of Mount Celestia, the pinnacle of ordered good on the multiverse! Home to the dwarven and halfling pantheons along with the host of celestial forces known as archons, Mount Celestia's seven layers hold wonder, beauty, excitement, and mystery for those willing to walk its paths and traverse its splendid scenery. From the shores of the Silver Sea to the Heavenly City that leads to the enigmatic seventh and ultimate layer, Mount Celestia is a plane full of surprises and wonder.

boardgame.name: Windswept Depths of Pandemonium
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the madness-fueled howling tunnels in the Windswept Depths of Pandemonium!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Windswept Depths of Madness, with dangerous windstorms, claustrophic tunnels, and an omnipresent madness strong enough to drive the toughest mind to utter insanity. Pandemonium is the home of the exiled and lost, but there are still plenty of adventure possibilities to be had across all four of its dangerous layers.

boardgame.name: Plane of Earth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventure and excitement within the stony depths of the Plane of Earth!

The Encounters in the Infinite Planes seeks to add flavor and excitement to the planes of existence by providing short scenarios that can be dropped into the key planar locations. The encounters are designed for specific tiers but can easily be adjusted up or down based on the capabilities of the party and the needs of the campaign.

Each encounter includes enough setup information to get started and hooks to get the party involved.

boardgame.name: Merchant of Jade Waters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An unusual merchant is paying well for bodyguards to accompany her on a “short journey across long distances.” The coin is good, but something about her offer seems unusual. Where does this offer of employment by the merchant of Jade Waters Guild lead?

Welcome to TLSP1-01 Merchant of Jade Waters, an adventure in the Tales of the Infinite Planes series! In this scenario, characters travel to the City of Glass on the Plane of Water in the employ of a marid merchant, but find they must track down missing goods once they arrive. The adventure is designed for a group of three to seven Tier 1 characters, levels 1 to 4, but optimized for APL 2.

A copy of Encounters in the Infinite Planes 02: Plane of Water is suggested to help add background to the plane and the City of Glass, but it is not required to run the adventure.

Adventure awaits inside the Tales of the Infinite Planes... will you risk opening it?

boardgame.name: Sierra Ops
boardgame.description:
After nearly decimating all of mankind over three centuries ago, humanity looked to the stars to rebuild their past glory. With the invention of terraforming technology, self-sustaining, man-made ecosystems and reliable space travel, large off-planet colonies and mining posts were soon established to feed the ever-growing human population. The power of the human race grew. However, with power comes corruption. With corruption comes imbalance. With imbalance comes unrest. With unrest comes war.

Play as Captain Junius Fahrenheit, a soldier of the United Terran Vanguard onboard the state-of-the-art ship, the Sierra, as him and his crew are thrown into humanity’s first interplanetary war. Tasked to protect Earth and free its colonies from under the Ares Confederacy of Mars’ grasp, there’s no question that he must fight to protect everything he stands for…

But what exactly is it he stands for? Who is right? Who is wrong? Does it even matter? Perhaps there’s more to this than meets the eye.

Game Features

Based on the indie game OPSD: Operation Space Defense
Real-time strategic gameplay
1080p visuals
Over 500,000 words split over four episodes, ten main story chapters, and twenty side quests
Ship and loadout customization

You only have so much time to act! Your decision of which missions to pursue and combat performance determine the state of the war and its survivors. Taking one opportunity is closing another!
Six characters to befriend one on one... maybe it’ll lead to romance?
Elaborate relationship system where your actions impact how deep your friendship runs
Wibbly wobbly weird stuff! (Not guaranteed)

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Best SF Fantasy Computer Wargame Nominee

boardgame.name: The Battle of Yu-Dong
大河滔滔
boardgame.description:
The Battle of Yu-Dong was the first large-scale army-level battle conducted in the eastern part of Henan Province(河南省) during the Chinese Civil War.
From June to July 1948, the East China Field Army(The Third Field Army of PLA), with the cooperation of the Central Plains Field Army(The Second Field Army of PLA), unexpectedly captured Kaifeng(开封), the capital of Henan Province , defeated the Ou Shounian(区寿年) Army in Sui County(睢县) and Qi County(杞县) areas. In the end, Qiu Qingquan(邱清泉) and Huang Baitao(黄百韬)'s Group Army jointly repelled the People's Liberation Army, and Kaifeng was able to recover.
In this battle, Su Yu(粟裕) led 200,000 troops to attack the Kuomintang’s 250,000 defenders.the CCP suffered 30,000 casualties and the KMT lost 90,000. Both sides claimed that they had won.
This mini wargame roughly expresses the combat characteristics of both sides with a simple mechanism. It is an excellent work.

boardgame.name: Infini
boardgame.description:
Infini is a psychedelic puzzle adventure in which you play as Hope falling endlessly in a mind-bending wraparound space.

Infini takes place in a world where concepts are personified. Hope is trapped in Infinity and is trying to escape. During his quest, Hope will interact with several other concepts such as Time, Poetry, War, Memory and Technology.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: PAGAN: Autogeny
boardgame.description:
A thousand worlds surround our own, composed of bits and bytes. When they die, where do they go; what secrets do they hide? Stumble ye, wayfarer, through the wreckage of a dead MMO.

PAGAN: Autogeny is an experimental first person open world role playing game set in the digital ruins of a largely abandoned MMORPG. It is heavily inspired by long-forgotten bargain-bin 1990s adventure games, and by a general ethos of user-hostile design.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: My Exercise
boardgame.description: Let's do sit-ups. Press the button and let a chubby boy do his exercise and sink into a dog's body. Maybe the animals will come to cheer him up. This is a festival of private comforts with the round-shape characters. Subtle secrets elements are hidden delicately. Do your exercise every day.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Smile For Me
boardgame.description:
Smile for Me is an immersive Nod n' Shake Adventure Game about making people... happy?

As "The Big Event" draws near, help the troubled residents of the Habitat and de-mask the mysterious Doctor Habit... before it's too late.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: LIONKILLER
boardgame.description: Play as Hua Mulan, a young lesbian who is conscripted into the First Opium War against the British Empire. Run a flower shop, kiss a girl, shoot a matchlock rifle, and uncover a military conspiracy! Your actions will lead you to one out of four different endings. Will you get the girl, or will you die an inglorious death?
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee

boardgame.name: American Election
boardgame.description:
You are an American. It is 2016. And you are being followed...

A dark political nightmare IF game about an alternate reality 2016, casting you in the role of a campaign assistant working to elect your candidate.

Run from your memories of your father, your mother, and the woman you left behind. Run from your choices. Run from the world.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee

boardgame.name: Adventures With Anxiety
boardgame.description: Based on my personal experience with anxiety disorder (and slowly healing), this is an interactive story about a human and their anxiety.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee

boardgame.name: LUNA The Shadow Dust
boardgame.description:
LUNA The Shadow Dust is a fully hand-animated Point&Click puzzle adventure, brought to life through wordless storytelling, beautiful cinematics and a breathtaking original soundtrack.
Inspired by the adventure games of old, LUNA The Shadow Dust is a moving tale of two playable companions drawn together in a hand-animated puzzle adventure, featuring a breathtaking original soundtrack and beautiful 2D cinematics.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2020 NAVGTR Award Best Family Game of the Year Nominee
2020 NAVGTR Award Best Puzzle Game of the Year Winner
2020 NAVGTR Award Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Don't Look
boardgame.description: Don't Look is a 3D side-view horror game using the Eye tracking technology. Play as a child who went looking for his dog in a dark and mysterious vicinity. Explore the environment controlling a flashlight with your eyes, but beware, things are lurking in the shadows…
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee

boardgame.name: Patrick's Parabox
boardgame.description:
Patrick's Parabox is a puzzle game about playing with recursion and infinities by pushing boxes into and out of each other. Each box contains its own 2-dimensional space that other boxes can enter and exit, creating ever deeper layers of boxes-within-boxes. This unique system gives rise to mind-bending puzzles which require a whole new way of thinking.

As the game progresses, the player slowly uncovers the full depth of the system. In situations where a box contains itself, you can use infinite recursion to your advantage to accomplish intricate feats. Elegant consequences emerge as the player delves into deeper layers of the system.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2019 IndieCade Developer Choice Award Winner
2020 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Winner

boardgame.name: The Space Between
boardgame.description:
The Space Between by Christoph Frey is a surreal short narrative experience in three acts about the walls we build for us.

The architect Martin Melanson, commissioned to build a theater, meets a woman named Clara, outside of his apartment complex at night. Attracted to each other, they visit the theater's building site.
While they explore the unfinished stage, surrounded by scaffolds and lost in thoughts, reality slowly fades, where the curtain opens and a dark play about closeness and separation begins.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: BORE DOME
boardgame.description: In the near future, human life has become perfect. Every aspect of life and existence has reached perfection. BORE DOME is a magical pill from the future, giving humans the option of experiencing imperfection and moments of mediocrity. BORE DOME can be consumed as entertainment, medicine, or as a document of something exotic, distant and extinct.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards Best Student Game Winner

boardgame.name: Evergreen Blues
boardgame.description:
Evergreen Blues is a suite of interactive songs by David Su and Dominique Star.

Originally developed at the MIT Media Lab, the game is a choice-based interactive song construction experience about the relationships between audiences, authors, and the characters and worlds they create. It uses a real-time lyric-choosing mechanic, and is designed for both single and multiplayer play.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards Best Student Game Nominee

boardgame.name: A Fisherman's Tale
boardgame.description: It's a fun puzzle game that perfectly challenges you in the sense that it's not super hard, but it's not super easy either.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2019 NAVGTR Award Best Game Direction of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Valraven: Le Cronache del Sangue e del Ferro Quickstart
boardgame.description:
Calca i campi di battaglia di Valraven e sventa l'assassinio del tuo Condottiero nello Scenario "Il Destino di Widmar", pronto da giocare!

Nel Quickstart troverai:

- Le regole del Monad Echo per gestire la tua prima partita.
- I pilastri dell'ambientazione di Valraven, che ti restituiranno il sapore metallico di saghe come Berserk, Dragon Age e Le Cronache del Ghiaccio e del Fuoco.
- Il Destino di Widmar, uno Scenario pronto da giocare che porterà i Personaggi a sventare l'assassinio del loro Condottiero, e impedire che qualcosa di terribile succeda durante un'Eclissi.
- Quattro PG pregenerati, da utilizzare con Il Destino di Widmar o con uno Scenario di tua creazione.
boardgame.rpg: Valraven: Le Cronache del Sangue e del Ferro

boardgame.name: Twin Peak
boardgame.description: Movie, Book, TV show
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2019 NAVGTR Award Best Sound Effects of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Spike! Journal #10
boardgame.description:
Guest editor Vic Tallsnot (who is, incidentally, definitely not three Snotlings in a fancy costume) is on hand to help us understand why Snotlings have decided to form their own teams, and what it means for the future of Blood Bowl.

All 36 hilarious pages of this issue of Spike! Journal are packed to bursting with all the rules and advice a budding Snotling coach will need to play the ultimate underdogs in your games of Blood Bowl.

– It’s Not Easy Being Green: the history of Snotlings in the game, as well as a breakdown of the major positionals – Snotlings, Fungus Flingas, Fun-Hoppas, Stilty Runnas, Pump Wagons, and Trolls

– Profiles of famous Snotling teams, including the Crud Creek Nosepickers, plus rules, stats, and profiles for Star Players

– Star Player Spotlight: Ripper Bolgrot – this shockingly intelligent Troll mounted a successful legal battle to get Ugroth Bolgrot banned from Blood Bowl! His accomplishments on the pitch are equally impressive…

– Dirt from the Dugout: Mindy Piewhistle digs into the current trend of hiring Snotlings at Blood Bowl stadiums, and the somewhat less-than-desirable outcomes of the practice

– Star Player Spotlight: Fungus the Loon – This Goblin fanatic was raised by Snotlings, and he cares not for whom he swings his ball and chain, so long as he gets to smash things!

– Chat with the Rat: Hackspit Quillchewer interviews Zibbit, an enterprising Snotling who has dedicated his career to improving the design of the Pump Wagon

– Small, but Significant: Extensive and much-needed advice for playing, and winning, with Snotlings

– Star Player Spotlight: Nobbla Blackwart – Goblins and Snotlings both have a penchant for levelling the odds through a bit of, well, cheating! This Chainsaw-wielding loony adds some much-needed ultra violence to a Snotling team.

– Inducements and new Extraordinary Skills to give the little gits a leg up

– A new episode of the Mighty Blow! comic

Key Features
Rules and stats to field Snotlings
History and background on these most unlikely teams
A ridiculous and whimsical read for any Blood Bowl fan

-description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Snotling Pitch and Dugout Set
boardgame.description:
Snotlings win very few games, which means they have very little money to upgrade their Blood Bowl stadia, if they can even be called that with a straight face. More often than not, they'll play their games in the fungal bogs where they grow their hallucinogenic mushrooms – the floating spores make for a rather vivid experience for visiting teams.

This double-sided board depicts a fungal bog in two states: a slippery, swampy bog, and a field in full fungal bloom, filled with spores. The end zones are marked by a decrepit boardwalk, and the dugouts are hardly a safe place to rest and recover.

The package includes two double-sided dugouts to match the two styles of pitch. Each dugout features the usual Score tracker, Reserves, Knocked-out and Serious Injury boxes, and a re-roll tracker. You'll also find rules to represent the particular features of both sides of the pitch.

Key Features
Double-sided with matching dugouts
Muddy fungal bog on one side, mushroom-riddled version on the reverse
Includes special rules for both sides of the pitch

-description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Snotling Team Card Pack
boardgame.description:
This deck of 44 cards helps you focus on your game and keep track of your stats and special rules. Snotling teams are an all-new team with new positionals and lots of tricks up their sleeves.

Contents:
– 6 Reference cards for Snotlings, Fungus Flingas, Fun-Hoppas, Stilty Runnas, Pump Wagons, and Trolls
– 9 Reference cards for Star Players including Bomber Dribblesnot, Fungus the Loon, Nobbla Blackwart, and Ripper Bolgrot
– A Golden Era Star Player Reference Card for Bob Bifford
– 20 Blank cards that you can use to keep track of your own players
– A team roster card, with a match record on the reverse
– 3 Dirty Tricks cards (can be used by any team)
– 3 Miscellaneous Mayhem cards (can be used by any team)
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

Key Features
Full set of reference cards for Snotling teams
Includes blank cards for all 6 positions
Speed up your games and keep track of your roster, players, and special rules

-description from the publisher's website

listing.notes: Game is new-in-shrink and the game comes from a game-loving, smoke-free home.

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Snotling Team Dice Set
boardgame.description:
Snotlings have a… unique aesthetic. These translucent yellow-green dice look just like the substance that gave rise to the Crud Creek Nosepickers’ name! If you’re going to play Snotlings, you may as well go all in on the theme with this set of matching dice.

This set includes all of the dice you need to play:

CONTENTS

3 Blood Bowl Block dice
2 6-sided dice
1 8-sided dice
1 16-sided dice


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition)
Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition

boardgame.name: Scrap Wars
boardgame.description:
In Scrap Wars, units of opposing rebel factions fight each other on a vast playing field. By making use of landscape elements, the traits of individual units and the chances offered by effects tactical advantages may be achieved Tactics, as well as the right circumstances can decide the ultimate outcome of battle, with the goal of eliminating all units controlled by your fellow players.

Where other games try to approach realism, Scrap Wars sets itself apart by a playful and comedic nature. In a game of Scrap Wars players get ample opportunity to make life difficult for others and themselves and surprising twists occur regularly!

Units move over the board through an individually set maximum movement value, while spending energy.
Energy can be refilled but this is limited by distance and chance.
effect cards play a big role in getting benefits such as extra energy but also pose a risk because of negative effects.
Each unit also has a unique combination of effects that can be used during the game.

Combat is decided by two dices, one decides if a shot hits or misses, the other decides which part has been hit if the former die rolled a hit.
The number of times a unit may attack is decided by the number of equipped weapons on the unit and their range.
each unit has six parts that can be damaged or destroyed, if a part has been hit two times the part is considered to be destroyed.
if the head, the torso or both legs have been destroyed this is considered fatal.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: DinoGenics: Metal Credit Set
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your in game credit tokens from cardbord to metal! This 52 coin set includes the same number of credit tokens as the base game as well as the new 10 credit coins from Controlled Chaos.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: DinoGenics
DinoGenics: Controlled Chaos

boardgame.name: 異世界ギルドマスターズ (Isekai Guild Masters)
boardgame.description:
異世界ギルドマスターズ (Isekai Girudo Masuta-zu) (Isekai Guild Masters) is a Japanese board game of managing an adventurer guild. Isekai is a popular genre in Japanese culture, where characters travel to a different world. The game runs in just such a fantasy world that is set on 'an another world where persons of real world reincarnate to', and is full of the flavor text typical of the genre.

The mechanism of the game focuses on how much players can play by expanding reproduction without stress.

There is no direct attack with cards but the main interactions between players are through area control and quick taking of certain actions.

Each game play will go on differently due to each of the event cards are all unique (no duplicated cards in 105 cards total) and the other characters (who have unique ability) is dispatched to another player.

The game is inspired closely by the game Terraforming Mars, a favourite game of the designer.

このゲームは日本のライトノベルを題材とした「冒険者ギルド経営ゲーム」です。
「現実世界の人物がファンタジー世界に転移する」世界観のファンタジー世界で、フレーバーテキストが非常に充実しています。
システムは気持ちよく拡大再生産を行えることを重視しており、カードによる直接攻撃はなく、インタラクションは陣取り、特定アクションの早取りがメインです。
イベントカードはすべてユニーク（105種105枚）で、プレイヤーごとに違った受付嬢（能力持ち）が配布されるため、毎回異なった展開となり、リプレイ性が非常に高いゲームです。
publisher's summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Anthology
boardgame.description:
The Anthology book is a handy one-stop-shop for all the published rules for the smash hit The Walking Dead: All Out War miniatures game. The rules are updated with all the latest changes and FAQs. The book also includes a host of new exciting content and scenarios and new ways of playing for All Out War, along with the Call to Arms and Here’s Negan Walking Dead games, also from Mantic. Will you survive!?

—description from the publisher's website
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Walking Dead: All Out War
The Walking Dead: Call to Arms
The Walking Dead: Here's Negan – The Board Game

boardgame.name: Tarterian Depths of Carceri
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Open these pages and learn about the greatest prison in all the multiverse, the Tarterian Depths of Carceri!

The mythical Codex of the Infinite Planes is a massive book containing information on the very planes of existence. Too many for one document to tackle, so it's been divided up into volumes covering individual planes. Crack open the Codex in this continuing volume and learn about the Tarterian Depths of Carceri, the most infamous prison in all the multiverse. Six layers of misery and danger filled with castoff, discarded, or just plain dangerous denizens, all looking to betray and backstab their way to freedom.

boardgame.name: Encyclopedia Magica Tables
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Every item from the exhaustive Encyclopedia Magica series (all 4 volumes) compiled into random tables by Uncommon, Rare, Very Rare, Legendary, and Minor Artifact status, plus some tables to make each item unique. Enjoy!

boardgame.name: Klauth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

KLAUTH, "Old Snarl"

Dragons are powerful creatures of magic and might. They fill dreams and nightmares alike with splendor, majesty, and the raw force of their personality. Good, evil, and everything inbetween, dragons are the living embodiment of the truly fantastic. A series of articles in Dragon Magazine detailed the Wyrms of the North, giving a profile of the important dragons in the Sword Coast North region of the Forgotten Realms. This article updates that information, reorganizing it and adding more content, and provides details for the latest version of D&D!

The lands of Faerun are no stranger to dragons but few are as deadly as the great red wyrm Klauth, known as Old Snarl because of his nasty look. Dive into the world of this supremely powerful and surprisingly cunning red dragon with WYRMS OF THE REALMS: KLAUTH!

boardgame.name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Ascensión
Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Ascension
Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Ascesa
Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Aufstieg
Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – 升华
ウォーハンマー・クエスト：ブラックストーン・フォートレス：アセンション
boardgame.description:
The shifting chambers of the Blackstone Fortress rebuild themselves over and over, and ancient defence systems awaken, making navigating the mysterious structure more hazardous than ever. Doom hangs over Precipice, and if anyone is to warn the galaxy about the rising threat of the fortress, each of the survivors will have to confront their destiny.

Are your explorers ready for their final quest into the Blackstone Fortress? Continuing from the events in Deadly Alliance, The Seethe is now getting more powerful and threatens Precipice itself. This expansion includes two new hostiles in the form of Guardian Drones and a new "rolling road" mechanic that sees you explore the Blackstone Fortress as never before. If you can complete the quest, there is a whole host of bonus secret content to explore. Also included are rules for using Guardian Drones in games of Warhammer 40,000.

This set includes:

2 Guardian Drones
16-page Edge of the Abyss booklet
15 Exploration Cards
5 Encounter Cards
36 Fragment Cards
2 Resource Cards
2 Stronghold Artefact Cards
2 Hostile Reference Cards
11 Board Tiles
55 Counters and Markers
Assembly Guide
Repository envelope (containing your prize for completing the quest)
Bonus secret material


You will need a copy of Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress and Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Escalation to use the contents of this set.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: NIS, smoke free home, buyer pays shipping
Punched and models assembled but never played.
Ascesa Italiano ancora sigillato Spedisco solo in Italia Spedizione da aggiungere

boardgame.name: Feeding Frogs
boardgame.description:
Players must find the best Flies on the table to give them the highest score before the last Frog card is drawn to win. Use Frogs to your advantage to make sure you are in the best position come the end of the game! It will be over before you know!

The Frog cards will allow you to do certain things around the table like:
- Switch positions of the Flies
- View other players Flies to find where the best are
- Remove Flies from the game you don’t want other people (or yourself if they’re bad) to have
- Stop people from switching your own Flies

There’s loads you can do to help put yourself in the best position to win! So good luck!

May the frogs be ever in your favour!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Shadows of Lives Past
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of levels 7-9

Sometimes things go wrong in the Plane of Shadows.

Assignations are not always successful. Coups fail, or worse, succeed. When these things happen shadow fey seek out Theilynn Khova, who operates a covert Shadow Road for those seeking to disappear. She is assisted by Auceron, a dream squire, who handles much of the daily operations. This portal to the Shadow realm can be placed in any city or town.

boardgame.name: Akhamet Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book contains options to create a hero to tackle the many challenges of the desert or sailing on reed boats.

Pharaoh needs your help.

Inspired by the mythology of Ancient Egypt, Akhamet is a campaign setting that takes you to a place both unique and familiar.

This book expands on the material from the Campaign Setting and contains:

Expands on the Akhameti Pantheon by adding four new deities, from the beautiful Hathor, to Thoth the scribe, to the vengeful snake-headed Meretseger.
Ten new races, including the cow-headed Hathorians, to the vulture-headed Nefru and living mummies!
Six new class options, from the hoplite fighter to the divine agent rogue, to the divine sorcerer.
New backgrounds including the fake priest, the former cultist, the prophet, or the palace brat.
New feats, equipment, and magic items.
Learn about Akhameti society, new cities, and locations.
Explore the universe of the lands beyond Akhamet, the lands beyond death,
Discover the ancient states and kingdoms that existed within Akhamet and the lasting impression they left behind.


The sandstorm for 5th edition is here.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Dungeon Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the creation of The Book of Dungeon Encounters, I thought it would be fun to return to the dungeon with a dozen new encounter ideas. As a part of the A Dozen . . . series, each of the encounters that follow fit on a single page, making it easy for you – the gamemaster! – to print only the encounter you need for the current game session.

As with the other entries in this series, A Dozen Dungeon Encounters is a systemless work. You will need to provide the game statistics necessary to fit your preferred roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Dungeon Denizens
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Populating the dungeon is easy, right? You flip open a book of monsters, select a creature, and toss it behind the next door just as the adventurers are about to bash it down and continue their quest for treasure. At least, that’s one – very valid, in my opinion – way to approach stocking the dungeon with inhabitants.

Or, if you wish, you can take a different approach and make each monster found in the dungeon a little more than the speedbump between the heroes and their ultimate goal: finding more treasure!

A Dozen Dungeon Denizens details twelve monsters that are ready to join the more generic beasties in your next dungeon design. While a systemless work – like all of the entries in the A Dozen . . . series – this PDF includes more than just the name and description of a monster. The twelve monsters offered in this short work may be used as encounter seeds, with each entry existing for a single reason: to inspire you, the gamemaster!

A few of the twelve include a smattering of history, telling how the monster may have ended up in the dungeon, what it might be looking for in life, as well as how it will react to the party and what treasures (if any) it may have that the adventurers will no doubt wish to take.

Additionally, I have written a brief rumor about each of the monsters that may be used when the PCs are visiting a tavern or inn. They may overhear one of these rumors or, maybe, when asking around, one of the locals shares just the right piece of gossip that sends the party into the nearby dungeons.

boardgame.name: A Dozen More Dungeon Treasures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the second wave of A Dozen . . . series PDFs dove deep into specific treasure items with A Dozen Magic Armors, A Dozen Magic Helmets, and A Dozen Magic Shields, we return to a smorgasbord of dungeon treasures. This sequel to the first wave PDF, A Dozen Dungeon Treasures, brings you items that can be scattered throughout your campaign, either by dropping them into dungeons or making them available to the player characters when they visit the local magic shop. (A Dozen Magic Shops would make for a fun PDF, yes?)

As always, the items that follow do not include speciifc game statistics. Instead, gamemasters must create the stats for their game of choice. Where stat-like language is used, it is intended to work as a guide for the GM and not to be treated as some sort of concrete, unchangeable instruction. None of the game material I create is ever meant as the end-all and be-all on the topic. It is my hope that these treasures – as with eveyrthing released under the A Dozen . . . series – inspires you and leads you to create treasures of your own design.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Destructive Dragons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF was created for those gamemasters who wish to include dragons in the campaign. Personally, I have always thought that dragons should rarely appear in any campaign; an overuse of dragons can remove the sense of awe that the party should face each time that they encounter a dragon.

boardgame.name: A Dozen More Strange Locations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sequel to A Dozen Strange Locations, this PDF brings you another round of places that you can drop into your campaign as either a destination for the player characters to seek out or as an unusual spot that they come across when journeying across the game world.

The entries that follow are each limited to a single page. If you’re a fan of using paper at the table, you may choose to print only the page that you will need to use the chosen place. If you prefer using digital tools to manage your campaign, then you may want to copy the text from this document and paste it into your own file. Doing that will allow you to make changes and additions directly to the text, making the place your own.

As with other entries in the A Dozen . . . series of PDFs, there are no game statistics presented within this work. There are suggestions here and there (such as +1 to this, or 2d3 of that), but these notes are only offered to help steer you when you sit down to craft any stats necessary for your chosen game system. As with the descriptions of the places themselves, these semi-mechanics should be ignored if they don’t fit your needs.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Peculiar Lizardfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Similar in style to A Dozen Goblins and Orcs, this entry in the A Dozen . . . series of PDFs provides you, the gamemaster, with twelve lizardfolk creatures that the player characters may meet during the campaign.

A mix of non-player characters – intended to be used for roleplaying encounters – and monsters, the lizardfolk described on the following pages should (I hope) offer something for everyone, regardless of the type of game that you and your players enjoy. At the worst, each one gives you a starting point when creating encounters.

As always, you will not find game statistics on the following pages. This work exists as an inspirational tool for the GM and, as a systemless work, you will need to create any of the statistics necessary to use these lizardfolk in your chosen game system. A lot of times, when it comes to NPC stats, you need only create the exact statistics that should be needed for the planned encounter. In a roleplaying encounter, for example, there’s no need to deal with the creature’s combat statistics. Instead, just hit the highlights you will need to execute the roleplaying encounter (which is often almost zero actual stats).

boardgame.name: A Dozen More City Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome back to the city! A Dozen City Encounters, created thanks to the support of Kickstarter backers, has proven to be one of the most popular of the titles created as a part of the A Dozen Sinister Rumors campaign. That PDF has outsold several others since the close of the Kickstarter campaign, so it just makes sense that a second volume would be a must.

And what better way to bring new city encounters into existence than as a companion to the Fantasy City Sites and Scenes series? The following twelve encounters are for those of you who need even more inspiration for your city sessions.

boardgame.name: Horror Vids
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of the Pop Culture Catalog includes: Horror Vids! Featuring six pages and twice as many popular horror vids from the past century, this product details classics such as The Claw, Apex Predator, Hearttaker, and Weird Amidst the Waves. Each vid includes a special fandom perk that your character can gain using the fandom perk rules detailed within, as well as information about its production, director, actors, and year of release.

boardgame.name: The Nephilim
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The nephilim are a supernatural race of formerly divine beings for 5th Edition D&d.

Nephilim were crafted by the gods as servants, to protect ancient sites of divine value, guard ancient secrets or act as workers for their divine patrons. However, at some point in history they lost their connection to their gods divinity and were reduced to beings that are less than celestial, but more than mortal. They are a race with finite members, whose experiences and personalities are recycled by a metaphysical source that binds them all. They are born already adult from enchanted gemstone fragments that serve as their heart, and live until they return their essence to be used for the next generation.

This document contains the full race, descriptions of their tendencies, beliefs and social structures, the nature of their birth and unique relationship with death and their lack of an afterlife. Furthurmore, it outlines the various types of nephilim that may be present in their tribes, known as cusps, including a heroic variant that can be conjured as a heroic being to prevent or deter some world-shaking event.

The NPC stat blocks featured are

Nephilim Fatewatcher (CR 6)
Nephilim Faultguard (CR 1)
Nephilim Faulthawk (CR 1)
Nephilim Faultknight (CR 8)
Nephilim Elite Faultknight (CR 8)
Nephilim Silvercounter (CR 16)


Nephilim are a strong choice for players who want to play a character who knows they have a higher purpose. They are born with a goal. This goal is usually to protect some divine aspect or being, and so they can pursue that. They make excellent wizards, have utility in being able to fly and shed light and have the unique quality of being ageless and functionally immortal. A player who has a strong goal in mind for their character may find the directable nephilim to be just what they were looking for.

boardgame.name: Lotta tra dinosauri
boardgame.description:
15 herbivorous dinosaurs face 3 carnivorous ones in the middle of a prehistoric jungle.
Dinosaurs take turns moving on a grid. Carnivorous dinosaurs can jump over opponents to eat them, herbivores can't. Carnivores win by eating all opponents, herbivores by blocking them.
The game is a traditional variant of Fox and Geese, rethemed.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ...Beyond This Point Be Dragons...
The Dalluhn Manuscript
boardgame.description:
User summary:

...Beyond This Point Be Dragons... is thought to be a very early "edition" or implementation of Dungeons & Dragons. It frequently is referred to as the "Dalluhn Manuscript" (because it was purchased by Keith Dalluhn from a M. A. R. Barker garage sale).

The typewritten manuscript is uncredited and unique, and has occasioned extensive discussion regarding the earliest history and development of Dungeons & Dragons.

Copies of the document have circulated with increasing frequency, including some standardized and excellently produced PDF versions. The copyright status, origin, and provenance of the document are, at best, uncertain.

The internal pagination is discontinuous. Some researchers have suggested pages with only art could have been inserted into the document after its initial publication.

boardgame.name: Frozen II: Helft Olaf!
boardgame.description:
Poor Olaf! He has been blown apart by the wind and his whole body is now scattered around the forest. His friends Elsa, Anna, Kristoff and Sven get into the forest to search all his parts and re-assemble Olaf. With a bit of luck and a good memory, the players can support the friends in this task.

In this cooperative game the players move one of the friends, based on the result of the spinner, around the forest tracks. If the turn ends on one of Olaf‘s body parts, the players pick it up, show it to everyone and then place it backside up on the collection board. Once a player reaches a field depicting Olaf, the players can now try to assemble Olaf. But they need to remember well as he must be built in correct order, starting with the feet and if an incorrect part is turned over, this assembly round is over.

The friends win if they manage to collect all of Olaf‘s parts and assemble them before the wind reaches the end of its track and blows Olaf‘s parts away.

boardgame.name: Fragments of Rome
boardgame.description:
Locked away and forgotten, the broken and weathered Great Marble Map of Rome bears in its inscriptions the secrets of the ancient imperial city. Mere fragments are all that posterity has preserved of this once-four-story-tall map.

Yet, twenty-first century technology makes possible high-resolution imaging and matching of the crumbling marble fragments, presenting an opportunity to reconstitute this one-of-a-kind map crafted at the start of the third century.

In this cooperative tile-placement game for 1–4 players, you are one of a team of experts, entrepreneurs, and public figures tasked with reconstructing the monumental Great Marble Map of Rome. You must work together to construct an image of ancient Rome using tiles representing fragments of the map.

Yet, competition lies beneath the veneer of cooperation. Each player has an agenda influencing their work on the map. Balancing the conflicting interests of professors and politicians, real estate developers and museum curators will be as important as working together to assemble the map.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: PJ MASKS: Pyjamahelden auf Gangsterjagd
boardgame.description:
In this cooperative children‘s game, the three heroes need help to drive the villains Luna Girl, Romeo, Night Ninja and his Ninjalinos from the city.

To win the game the three heroes Owlette, Catboy, Gecko need to reach the headquarter of the PJ Masks before one of the villains does.

Each round one die determines which villain needs to be moved and how many pips are available to move one of the heroes.If a hero reaches a field with a villain, all shout „PJ MASKS!“ and bang their fists together. Depending on the hero, there follows a small dexterity element of moving around the table without dropping the standee of the villain from your head (Owlette), back (Catboy) or palm (Gecko).

boardgame.name: Franklin and Ghost: Bad Guy Brawl
boardgame.description:
Franklin, Ghost and Delilah are coming back at ya in a brand new card game full of chaos, backstabbing, bluffing, and of course... Mayhem.

You and up to 5 friends are helping your favorite heroes take on hordes of bad guys. Every round you'll be fighting off aliens, robots, rednecks and of course some big bads all while competing to see who can take down the most of them. Be careful though if you take on too many you're going down. Call in help from Franklin Ghost and Delilah for special effects and powers!

You are dueling symbiotes trying to rack up the most impressive kill combos without biting off more than they can chew and getting killed. You need to lock in the highest scoring hand you can without busting. Points are scored for pairs of cards and runs at least three cards long. You bust if you draw 3-of-a-kind (they were overwhelmed by a group of the same type of enemy). Gameplay begins with all players being dealt a hand of 3 cards. On your turn you first draw a card from the deck and can then choose to lock your hand in by placing their cards face down on the table. You also have action tokens that let you do all sorts of things to help yourself and trip up the other players.

It’s a quick push your luck card game with enough special powers to keep things fresh.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mercurial
Mercurial: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
After an arduous journey through the otherworldly land of Valanyr, your caravan finally arrives at Camp Trinity — a young, thriving settlement built atop a ruined kingdom once decimated by an ancient cataclysm.

Like many here, you were previously a mage of low renown now seeking a better fortune. The cataclysm altered Valanyr's Elan to be fertile but mercurial, rendering the rules of spellcasting different from whence you came. Here, the usually separate elements of nature fuse readily, allowing for new and unknown spells to be created. You'll have to start from scratch, but unknown means new discoveries to be made, and a thriving settlement means opportunity...

Mercurial is an card & dice-manipulation game themed on spellcrafting with combo & engine-building mechanics. Learn magical Alteration techniques to control the chaos of your elemental dice, and use these elements to combine lesser magicks into new and unknown spells. Your combined spells can either inflict ruin, restore life, or something more — use them to perform heroic deeds, ranging from helping your allies defeat dangerous beasts, to finding a path for stranded travellers lost in the strange land of Valanyr.

In Mercurial, each player has varying capabilities and starting resources, with their differences offering a unique path to power with every journey. Delve into the fantastic world of Mercurial, and discover a new age of spellcrafting.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Spaces Between Dreams
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

there are certain feelings that hit us whenever we walk down a hallway at night, stare at a weirdly painted waiting room, or examine a grainy picture of an off-putting room or hallway online.

there are times that comfort could be felt, there are times that unease takes over instead.

nevertheless, this fascinates our never-ending sense of curiosity.

and because of this, you decided to enter a realm where they are abundant.

but how? what happened? and who are you?

it’s up to you.

what matters is that you are here.

boardgame.name: Start-Up Sequence
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A personal one-on-one storytelling game. The player plays a mech pilot who is starting up their ex-partner's mech for the first time after a long absence, and must face the memories and emotions that are involved with attempting to activate the mech.

boardgame.name: Parched
boardgame.description:
Parched is a coaster-based board game in which two competing players race to irrigate their hop or coffee bean farm. The octagonal, coaster pieces are reorganized by opponents through a card laying mechanic to create a blue line of waterway edges from the water source to their respective end coaster. Trick-taking card play is augmented by action cards allowing players set up large changes in the board state, and the presence of event cards introduces a small element of randomness. Whatever the methods, the goal is simple: connect your farm to the water source through a series of irrigation channels. How hard can it be?

What is a coaster-based board game?
Parched has dual functionality as a game and set of coasters. The game is housed in a wooden display case that is intended to live out on a coffee table or bar top, so that sealed, wooden game tiles are always within reach to hold a drink. This novel idea isn't a gimmick, though, the functionality is a logical offshoot of the story behind the game itself.

The Story
Reseco is a country with a rich history of brewing coffee and beer; however, recent drops in rainfall and redirection of water to a burgeoning kale and avocado industry are causing ripples across an increasingly arid landscape. The people are parched and so are their crops: beans and hops. Determining where the limited water gets directed is problematic, to say the least. Koffee Kings and Best Buds Hops find themselves at the center of the problem. They have come together to solve the issue using what they have on hand, drinking vessels and coasters, to negotiate the direction of irrigation channels on their overlapping properties.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Soccer Blast Pro Soccer Game: International Football Legends Expansion
boardgame.description:
This amazing new card set was created by soccer aficionado and historian Bill Hild.

Included innovations such as "doubled qualities" for a few super-star players—which bringing added depth and realism to the cards and elevates the performances of the greatest-of-the-great.

There are 22 teams, each with 20 players and three goal keepers. A few of the world’s dominant soccer nations—Argentina, Brazil, England, for example—have had so many great players over so many years, they were allotted two teams in this set. (Rosters for each team are shown below.)
Over 500 of the greatest soccer stars who ever took the pitch, each team presented in “national” colors.
